summary: This is a letter from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Berman, submitting courtesy copies of the Government's supplemental detention submission in the case U.S. v. Jeffrey Epstein. It includes both redacted and unredacted versions, with three exhibits, two of which are requested to be filed under seal.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Appears as a recipient copied on the correspondence regarding the Epstein case filing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (U.S. v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB)).

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge to whom the letter and supplemental submission are addressed.

connections.description: Judge Berman is the presiding judge in the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Government's Supplemental Detention Submission Filed
events.description: The Government files a supplemental submission regarding Jeffrey Epstein's detention, including redacted and unredacted versions with sealed exhibits.

keyFacts: The document is a 2019 correspondence from a federal prosecutor to Judge Berman in the Jeffrey Epstein criminal case.
It submits a supplemental detention filing with both public and sealed components.
The filing includes three exhibits, with Exhibits B and C requested to be filed under seal, indicating sensitive information.
